## Reason of admission
69 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-08 with a bit swollen right leg since three days. Patient noticed progress of swelling and appearance of redness and diffucluty walking on day 3. Temp 39 degrees Celsius. 

## Medical history
Hypertension, diabetes mellitus type 2, chronic kidney disease stage 3

## Hospital course
On examination not so swollen right leg with not so defined redness and a little pain when palpated. CRP 279. Leukocytes 16,2. P-Creatinine 137. Started Fenoximetylpenicillin 1 gram x 3 per os for suspected erysipelas. To exclude the presence of deep vein thrombosis in the right leg the patient underwent an ultrasound examination which did not reveal any signs of DVT. Patient recieved oxynorm and was able to mobilise the leg. No fever. No pain. CRP 147, leukocytes normalized, P-crea 128. Ward nurse informed patients wife and planned for transporatation home on 2024-01-11.
